results.name: Expansion of theta_4(q)^2*theta_4(q^2)^4 in powers of q.
comment: Number 8 of the 74 eta-quotients listed in Table I of Martin (1996).
Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
reference: N. J. Fine, Basic Hypergeometric Series and Applications, Amer. Math. Soc., 1988; p. 85, Eq. (32.7).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
F. Jarvis, H. A. Verrill, Supercongruences for the Catalan-Larcombe-French numbers, Ramanujan J (22) (2010) 171.
Y. Martin, Multiplicative eta-quotients, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 348 (1996), no. 12, 4825-4856, see page 4852 Table I.
Michael Somos, Index to Yves Martin's list of 74 multiplicative eta-quotients and their A-numbers
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q)^4 * eta(q^2)^6 / eta(q^4)^4 in powers of q.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2), A(x^4)) where f(u, v, w) = v^2 * (u - v)^2 - 4 * u*w * (v - w) * (u - 2*v).
Expansion of phi(-q)^2 * phi(-q^2)^4 in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 15 2007
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (4 t)) = 128 (t/i)^3 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A050470.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (QPochhammer[ q^2]^3 (QPochhammer[ q] / QPochhammer[ q^4])^2)^2, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, May 24 2015 *)
a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, Boole[n == 0], -4 DivisorSum[ n, #^2 KroneckerSymbol[ -4, #] &]]; (* _Michael Somos_, May 24 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, -4 * sumdiv( n, d, d^2 * kronecker( -4, d)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^4 * eta(x^2 + A)^6 / eta(x^4 + A)^4, n))};
(MAGMA) A := Basis( ModularForms( Gamma1(4), 3), 51); A[1] - 4*A[2]; /* _Michael Somos_, May 24 2015 */
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 05 2006
